description: Updates a CloudFront origin access control.

parameters.name: OriginAccessControlConfig
parameters.description: An origin access control. A name to identify the origin access control. You can specify up to 64 characters. Description (string) --- A description of the origin access control. The signing protocol of the origin access control, which determines how CloudFront signs (authenticates) requests. The only valid value is sigv4. Specifies which requests CloudFront signs (adds authentication information to). Specify always for the most common use case. For more information, see origin access control advanced settings in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide. This field can have one of the following values: always --- CloudFront signs all origin requests, overwriting the Authorization header from the viewer request if one exists. never --- CloudFront doesn't sign any origin requests. This value turns off origin access control for all origins in all distributions that use this origin access control. no-override --- If the viewer request doesn't contain the Authorization header, then CloudFront signs the origin request. If the viewer request contains the Authorization header, then CloudFront doesn't sign the origin request and instead passes along the Authorization header from the viewer request. WARNING: To pass along the Authorization header from the viewer request, you must add the Authorization header to a cache policy for all cache behaviors that use origins associated with this origin access control. The type of origin that this origin access control is for.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: A name to identify the origin access control. You can specify up to 64 characters.

nested_params.name: Description
nested_params.description: A description of the origin access control.

nested_params.name: SigningProtocol
nested_params.description: The signing protocol of the origin access control, which determines how CloudFront signs (authenticates) requests. The only valid value is sigv4.

nested_params.name: SigningBehavior
nested_params.description: Specifies which requests CloudFront signs (adds authentication information to). Specify always for the most common use case. For more information, see origin access control advanced settings in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide. This field can have one of the following values:

nested_params.name: OriginAccessControlOriginType
nested_params.description: The type of origin that this origin access control is for.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the origin access control that you are updating.

nested_items.name: OriginAccessControl
nested_items.description: The origin access control after it has been updated.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the origin access control.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: A name to identify the origin access control. You can specify up to 64 characters.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the origin access control.

nested_items.name: SigningProtocol
nested_items.description: The signing protocol of the origin access control, which determines how CloudFront signs (authenticates) requests. The only valid value is sigv4.

nested_items.name: SigningBehavior
nested_items.description: Specifies which requests CloudFront signs (adds authentication information to). Specify always for the most common use case. For more information, see origin access control advanced settings in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide.
always --- CloudFront signs all origin requests, overwriting the Authorization header from the viewer request if one exists.
never --- CloudFront doesn't sign any origin requests. This value turns off origin access control for all origins in all distributions that use this origin access control.

no-override --- If the viewer request doesn't contain the Authorization header, then CloudFront signs the origin request. If the viewer request contains the Authorization header, then CloudFront doesn't sign the origin request and instead passes along the Authorization header from the viewer request. WARNING: To pass along the Authorization header from the viewer request, you must add the Authorization header to a cache policy for all cache behaviors that use origins associated with this origin access control.

nested_items.name: OriginAccessControlOriginType
nested_items.description: The type of origin that this origin access control is for.

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The new version of the origin access control after it has been updated.
